newsitem.title: ROMANIA: TEXT OF ROMANIA FOREIGN INVESTMENT DECREE (7 of 7).
newsitem.headline: TEXT OF ROMANIA FOREIGN INVESTMENT DECREE (7 of 7).

text.p: (This is an unofficial translation of Romania's government Decree no.31/16.06.1997 on foreign investment. The unofficial translation was provided by Price Waterhouse Romania.
For any querries please contact Price Waterhouse at telephone +40-1 311-2455, fax +40-1 312-3334.)
CHAPTER SEVEN (of seven)
Final Provisions

Art. 22 (1) The fiscal incentives provided in Article 6, Article 7, paragraph (2), Article 8, paragraph (1) and Article 10 herein, as the case may be, shall be applicable to any company incorporated as a Romanian legal person, as of the date of the increase of the share capital but only until the end of the preiod for which the initial incentives have been granted through Law 35/1991, with the subsequent amendments, to the extent that, by making such increase, the participation of the foreign capital, as provided in Article 1, paragraph (1), is constituted or supplemented uo to the attainment of the benchmark qualifying for the garnt of the respective incentives.

(2) The incentives stipulated in art.6 are also to be granted to trade companies, Romanian legal persons, with production activity and/or industrial services; for these companies, the participation of the foreign investor(s) with actual capital paid in cash represent minimum 20 percent of the share capital, but not less than USD 200,000 or the equivalent of this amount, expressed in any other freely convertible currency and/or in Romanian lei.

Art.23 (1) The criteria and conditions which must be satisfied for the grant of additional incentives, as well as the procedure by which a company qualifies for the terms and amounts provided under the Article 8 herein shall be set forth methodological rules approved by the Government, upon the recommendation of the Ministry of Finance and the Romanian development Agency.

(2) The criteria and conditions which must be satisfied for the garnt of additional incentives, as well as the procedure by which a company qualifies for the terms and amounts provided under the Article 10 herein shall be set forth by methodological rules issued jointly by the Ministry of Finance, the state Ownership Fund and the Romanian Development Agency, and approved by the Government Decision.

Art.24 (1) The companies established as Romanian legal entities with partial or total foreign capital participation, which satisfy the provisions of Article 1, paragraph(2) herein, may acquire, at any time during their existence, the right of ownership and any other real rights to the land which is necessary for the fulfillment or expansion of their own object of activity.

(2) In the case of the dissolution and liquidation of the companies mentioned in the previous paragraph, the liquidators shall transfer the rights to the land, within one year from the date of passing the liquidation resolution, only to the persons having the legal capacity to acquire such assets.

Art.25 The companies referred to in article 1, paragraph (2) herein benefit from the right to fully charge to their costs of the expenses incurred by activities related to advertising/publicity and/or promotion of products and/or services.

Art.26 (1) The Government is authorized to establish, by Decisions, the special status applicable to certain foreign investments made as provided herein, in a limited number of cases and justified exclusively by reasons of social protection or regional development.

(2) The foreign investments provided in the preceding paragraph may benefit of guarantees granted for external credits, within the limit of an annual amount from the Special Development Fund available to the Government, set by the Ministry of Finance.

Art.27 (1) The foreign staff required for the operation of the foreign investment, irrespective of the form in which such investment has been made under the present Emergency Ordinance, may be employed only for managerial and expert positions.

(2) The rights and obligations of the Romanian and foreign staff employed for activities performed for the foreign investment shall be those provided by the law and determined by the agreement of the parties.

Art.28 The provisions of this Emergency ordinance are applicable solely to the extent that the international agreements and conventions concerning the foreign investments, to which Romania is a party, do not provide for a different status.

Art.29 The provisions of the Emergency Ordinance are applicable solely to the extent that the international agreements and conventions concerning the foreign investments, to which Romania is a party, do not provide for a different status.

Art.30 (1) In the moment of registering the company (a Romanian legal person) with foreign capital participation, with the Trade Register, or, case by case, on the date of paying the price of the stock of shares bought from the State Ownership Fund, the investor is to pay a fee in the range of 0.2 percent and 0.5 percent for the Special Development Fund available to the Government.

(2) The fee charged is computed based on an inverse proportion of the amount of the foreign investment carried out and/or according to the economic importance of the field in which the foreign investment is carried out.

Art. 31 (1) The foreign investments falling under the provisions of Articles 13 14-16 of the Foreign Investment Law No 35 of 1991, as subsequently amended and supplemented, and which, prior to December 31, 1994 had been registered with the Trade Register and for which the incentives stipulated by that law have been requested, shall continue to enjoy the respective incentives.

(2) In order to benfit from the incentives determined hereunder, the foreign investments referred to in the preceding paragraph must comply with the terms set forth by the Emergency Ordinance within twelve (12) months from the date of its coming into effect.

(3) As of the date upon which the incentives provided herein are granted at its request to a foreign investor, the foreign investments referred to in paragraph (1) shall cease to enjoy the incentives granted under Law No35 of 1991.

(4) The provisions of the preceding paragraphs shall also be applicable, accordingly, to foreign investments which obtained incentives under Law No 71 of 1994, regarding incentives granted in addition to Law No 35 of 1991, as republished, regarding the attraction of foreign investment in the industrial sector.
(5) As of the date of coming into force of this Emergency Ordinance no Investor Certificates shall be issued to foreign investors failing to comply with the conditions herein.

Art.32 As of the date of the coming into egffect of this Emergency Ordinance the provisions of the following regulatory acts shall cease to be valid: Foreign Investment Law No 35 of 1991, published in Monitorul Oficial al Romaniei, part I, No 73 of April 10 1991, republished in Monitorul Oficial al Romaniei, part 1., No 185 of August 2, 1993, as amended;

Law No 71 of 1994, regarding the granting of facilities in addition to those provided by Law No 35 of 1991, republished, regarding the encouragement of foreign investors in the industrial sector, published in Monitorul Oficial al Romaniei, part I, No 189 of July 22, 1994, as well as any contrary provisions contained in Government Ordinance No 70 of 1994, regarding the profit tax, published in Monitorul Oficial al Romaniei, part I, No 246 of August 31 1994, approved and amended by Law No 73 of 1996, republished in Monitorul Oficial al Romaniei, part I, No 40 of 12 March 1997.

Art 33. Within 30 days from the date upon which this Emergency Ordinance comes into effect, the Romanian Development Agency, the State Ownership Fund and the Ministry of Finance shall issue methodological norms necessary for its application and submit to the government for approval the methodological rules required for its application.
